title: Charitable Gift Annuities
source: dev-notes/WP-pages/legacy giving(Planned giving's new name)/Charitable Gift Annuities – AGFinancial.html
html:
Home » Services » Legacy Giving » Charitable Gift Annuities

Generous.

Rewarding, too.

Tax benefits.

Ministry support.

Payments for life.

…and completely unaffected by the economy. Through a Charitable Gift Annuity (CGA), your generosity has the power to bless both the ministries and the people you love—with fixed payments, potential tax deductions, and attractive rates.

How it works
1. Fund the gift

You fund the gift with cash or securities, and should receive an immediate charitable deduction.

2. Invest & pay

AG Foundation invests those assets and pays you a fixed amount (according to your age) every year for the rest of your life.

3. Support

When you pass away, the remainder goes to support ministry.

It starts with your gift.
  • Cash (a significant portion of the annuity income may be tax-free)
  • Appreciated securities (may avoid a portion of capital gains tax)
  • $10,000 minimum

The SECURE 2.0 Act of 2022 allows you to fund a Charitable Gift Annuity with funds distributed from your IRA­—up to $50,000* of your annual Qualified Charitable Distribution limit (QCD).** This charitable distribution amount is both retirement income for you, and a gift of support to a ministry you choose. Even better, this distribution can count toward your IRA’s annual Required Minimum Distribution (RMD). You’re permitted to take advantage of this unique opportunity only once.

Learn more about this

*Indexed annually for inflation

**Also available for Charitable Remainder Unitrust (CRUT) LINK TO THIS or Charitable Remainder Annuity Trust (CRAT) LINK TO THIS
Restrictions apply.

How it works

Fund the gift with cash or securities, and receive an immediate charitable deduction.
We invest those assets and pay you a fixed amount every year for the rest of your life.
The payment amount—a portion of which may be tax-free—depends on your age. When you pass away, the remainder goes to support the ministry(ies) you’ve chosen. A CGA is a contract between you and AG Foundation.

Assets you may give

Minimum funding of a CGA is $10,000.

The SECURE 2.0 Act of 2022 allows you to fund a Charitable Gift Annuity with funds distributed from your IRA­—up to $50,000* of your annual Qualified Charitable Distribution limit (QCD).**

You may fund your CGA with:

  • Cash (a significant portion of the annuity income may be tax-free)
  • Appreciated securities (may avoid a portion of capital gains tax)

This charitable distribution amount is both retirement income for you, and a gift of support to a ministry you choose. Even better, this distribution can count toward your IRA’s annual Required Minimum Distribution (RMD). You’re permitted to take advantage of this unique opportunity only once.

*Indexed annually for inflation

**Also available for Charitable Remainder Unitrust (CRUT) or Charitable Remainder Annuity Trust (CRAT) Restrictions apply.

How it works

A Charitable Gift Annuity is a contract between you and AG Foundation. When you fund the gift, with cash or securities, we invest the assets and provide fixed payments to you for life. Payments and rates are calculated based on your age at the time your gift is funded. A portion of each payment may be tax-free. You will receive a charitable deduction for your gift of the remainder to ministry and enjoy the satisfaction of furthering ministry later.

Charitable Gift Annuity Options

Immediate

Start receiving payments now.

If you desire current income, you may transfer cash or securities in exchange for a contract for payment to begin within four weeks. You should receive a current income tax charitable deduction for the value of your gift to AG Foundation.

Deferred

Receive payments in the future.

Deferment compresses payout into a shorter time frame, so your annual payments will be higher than an immediate CGA. You should receive a current charitable income tax deduction.

Try the CGA estimator

Test drive a CGA.

See how your payments and ministry impact might look.

Charitable gift annuity created for you

Annuity Type: One Life • 6.3% • Monthly

Gift of $1,000,000 receives approximately $5,250 per month ($63,000, about 6.3% of your gift). You can claim a charitable deduction of $350,000, and about 17.1% of each payment is tax-free for about 16 years.

Adjust the example

Advanced ▸ (demo §7520, capital gains %, min age)

Your Gifted Asset: $1,000,000

Basis $300,000 • Gain $700,000
Capital gain treatment may be reduced when funding a CGA.

Your Ministry Impact

$307,096
Remainder depends on longevity and earnings; shown illustratively.

Your Lifetime Payments

$5,250 / month
Annual total: $63,000
Tax-free portion: $900 per month
Taxable portion: $4,350 per month
Rate based on age(s) per ACGA guidelines.

Figures are illustrations for education only and may differ from a personalized ACGA/§7520-based calculation. For a compliant multi-page PDF, please chat with an AGFinancial representative.

Begin

Your gifts are more powerful than you think.

When you’re ready for tax deductions, fixed payments, and attractive rates—all while supporting ministry—we’re ready to walk you through the setup process.

Plenty of options.
Explore other charitable and legacy giving strategies.
Discover more

Except for California, your Assemblies of God Charitable Gift Annuity will be issued by Assemblies of God Foundation (“AG Foundation”) and will be a general obligation of the organization. Charitable Gift Annuities are not available in Alabama, Hawaii, Montana, New Jersey, New York, or Washington.

Additional information for California residents: Annuities are subject to regulation by the State of California. Payments under this agreement, however, are not protected or otherwise guaranteed by any government agency or the California Life and Health Insurance Guarantee Association. AG Foundation does not practice law and no legal advice is provided. If you need legal advice, you should consult your own legal counsel. Your Assemblies of God Charitable Gift Annuity will be issued by the General Council of the Assemblies of God (“General Council”) and will be a general obligation of that organization. AG Foundation is responsible for the management of your gift annuity.

Additional information for Oklahoma residents: A Charitable Gift Annuity is not regulated by the Oklahoma Insurance Department and is not protected by a guaranty association with the Oklahoma Insurance Department.

Additional information for South Dakota residents: Charitable Gift Annuities are not regulated by and are not under the jurisdiction of the South Dakota Division of Insurance.
